c-0: ^, I copy, but communication is very disturbed.

s: ^/I'm opening the gate of the abandoned city.

g-1: ^Can you also check the other automated mechanisms of the city?
^/I definitely cannot. This is the problem.
^/The city almost works on its own by now.
^We'll have to neutralise the threat without counting on you.
g-2: ^/Not for long, you are right. In one year, the city will be razed to the ground, for good.
^Over and out. Catch up with you later.

mine_field: ^We are on a dirt road between empty warehouses.
^There's a rusted sign. Impossible to read, and not just because it's dark, here.

g-0: ^I didn't expect it to be that dangerous here.
^/Artificial intelligence reorganised it in unpredictable ways.
^We'll be sending a deminer to fetch the body.
^Let's complete the mission now. And try to predict the unpredictable, too.

description: ^We thought we detected motion in the distance, but in this darkness…

c-1: ^Sounds like a truly nonsense advice to me.
^Rather, help us understand where we're at.
g-0: ^There's an imposing building in front of us.

s: ^/I believe I know where you are.

c-2: ^It's a cylinder. Must have 10 floors minimum.
^On a neon sign I read: «Automated City Newscast: FM 109.0».

g-0: ^/That passageway was used by the migrant traffickers.
^Actually, I see something in a corner that may be human remains.
^We found a sphere in a room and we picked it up.
^It's a translucent metal shell, filled with an amber-coloured gel.

c-3: ^I can tell you're not familiar with emergency scenarios.
^This thingy is like a fire extinguisher.

c-0: ^/They used to do… dangerous experiments in this building.

s: ^/Ah, do as you wish. It's your life.

c-0: ^Never heard of viruses attacking metal items.
^We're keeping the measles sphere, don't stress me.
c-1: ^We got a Geiger counter and detect no special radioactivity here.
^We're keeping the "radioactie" spehere, don't stress me.
c-2: ^Alright, alright. If you care that much, we're dropping it.

c-5: ^Then we did good by taking it!

g-1: ^We're checking the rooms one by one.

c-3: ^Climb to the seventh floor, you'll find one window.
c-4: ^Can you believe it? The door is still closed.

c-0: ^In the middle of the room, there's

s0: ^Ah! I could swear I saw it moving

c-0: ^Yeah. As if it were trying to open, but the bar is holding it shut.
^Broken tiles, metal pipes, debris… that kind of stuff.
^Sounds useless but let's give it a try.
^Don't know what to say: they're dead guys.
^What the fuck are we checking them for?
^I guess they got shot by somebody or something that's in that manhole.
c-1: ^I can tell you that there ain't a damn thing to tell about them.

s: ^/If you're too scared, leave it alone.

c-1: ^Isn't there anyone more skilled to replace you?
g-0: ^The metal bar is there to stay.

c-3: ^/Go back to the opposite side, beyond the rooms.

hell_breaks_loose: ^There was an automated turret below the "manhole cover".
^Got an injured soldier. We cannot leave her here!
^We need to bring her outdoor at least, for the rescue drone.
^Why did you have us remove the bar?
^How do we get out of here for fuck's sake?
solution: ^We're out, on a very steep road.
^The seventh floor was at street level!

c-0: ^, the city is in an area with massive elevation changes.
g-0: ^What a shithole, perfect for the vermin.

c-1: ^ crossed the border in that way.

g-1: ^That's why you got a garbage accent.
^What should we do with the girl?
^The bleeding stopped, call in the drone.
^We don't even have a radio to give her.

downhill: ^Last time I saw such a fog must have been ages ago.

s: ^/Let's switch back to non-romantic interaction mode

g-0: ^/You're on a hilltop, aren't you? Roll down.

river: ^Oh no… what's that, a river? They swim easily, of course.

s: ^/On the river bank there are boats you can use.

g-0: ^Good. Decrease the inflow: it's too strong now.

c-4: ^Stop the flow! Stop the fucking flow!
^He seems to have made it. He didn't drown.
^But he cannot continue, we're leaving him here with a thermal blanket and a beacon.

c-1: ^ /O-K. I called in the rescue drone.

lunch_time: ^You never eat, around here, do you?

problem: ^There might be a moat, ahead of us. A very deep one.
^In order to reach the castle, we need to overcome this hassle.

c-0: ^It's 20 metres at least, the walls are smooth and perfectly vertical.
^Hmm. I see something mechanical and intimidating moving around.

s: ^/OK, I daresay the conditions are suboptimal.

c-1: ^/Send somebody down with a rope or something…
^/You're not as brave as you say…
^The balustrade above the moat has a gap of a few metres.
^In that spot, there's a kiosk, there's… Looks like a computer display.
^I sent a soldier to look around.

s0: ^ and the electrified fences prevent us from walking around the moat

c-2: ^e'll end up too far away from the target if you can't find a way to access the fortified building.
c-3: ^The sphere we collected in the tower?
^/Yes. I read somewhere that it can be used to unlock electronic devices.
^It sounds like a crap theory, but you're the tech guy.
^I believed it was a fire extinguisher.
^Now the sphere is at the bottom of the moat.
c-4: ^It's asking for a passcode to open the gateway, but I don't understand which gateway.

c-0: ^/If it's the same system used in the southern bastions, it changes twice per hour.
^/Therefore we cannot try all hundred thousand of them.
^Thank goodness: we're not trained to be very patient.

guessed_code: ^A panel in the wall is rotating about a pivot…
all_safe: ^/We didn't need to try a hundred thousand, did we?

lost: ^/How long is it taking? You should already be at the next building.
^Off track my arse: we are going west!

description: ^Well, well, I suppose we just entered the Ludodrome.
^It was only to be expected from them.
^If you don't force them to here, they want to come anyway.
^/However, according to the sensors they didn't pass through there.

g-0: ^They ran through the iron catwalks of the Coalosseum.
^Rather, tell me that we have another option to cross this giant hall.

s: ^/You may get out of the Ludodrome

b:
^Not in single file, idiots!

^Each on their own catwalk!

^If you are not exactly told what to do, every time, you are totally inept.

^We are only two, we get a catwalk each, Sergeant.

^Swift.

g-1: ^/Not all catwalks are going to be bridged, but you may just need to take a longer step, it's not hard.

problem: ^There are flare-ups happening on some catwalks!

g-0: ^/Only one path is supposed to have fire, isn't it?
^/Have you got something to put out the fire?

b: ^ According to you, we shouldn't have because it was contaminated…

walk_with_sphere: ^/Excellent. It contains a substance that should extinguish the flames.
^Except that we need to find out who's bringing this sphere.

g-1: ^We had to bandy the sphere like a volleyball match but we're safe and sound, all
^Go get the bastards! Load your weapons!

walk_without_sphere: ^Alright, we're making an attempt just the same.

b: ^Go get the bastards and then we'll provide for the injured.
^I go get the bastards and then I'll provide for the other, injured.
^The Sergeant was burned alive. And it's all my fault.

solution: ^/I told you they were not there. Exit from the North-West side.

self_confidence: ^/At this point, it would be awful.
^Explain the Ludodrome thing. You said it's illegal.

s: ^/Sure. The videos make billions on the Internet.

g-0: ^I assumed they were only filmed abroad.
^/They were used to fund the automated city.
^/It's part of the scandal that had it shut down.
^Shame, I quite enjoyed watching the golliwogs burn.

factory_west: ^We reached a massive warehouse or something.
^What's it for? Nobody lives here anymore.
^/No shit, but the city automation didn't get it.
^This way it will end up feeding the porch monkeys on the run.

g-0: ^There's a sign: «Don't trespass. Identify on FM 102.5».

b:
^Wait.

^I'm letting the others enter from here, while I try to catch them from behind.

^Wait.

^I'm letting the other soldier enter from here, while I try to catch them from behind.
^I'm the only one left, but that should be enough.

g-1: ^I don't want them to escape from the other entrances.

infiltrate: ^/You're alone, you've got to move silently.
^/Be careful not to make any noise.

b: ^There's no risk, the conveyor belt is still working.

^Shut up.

^I'm at the conveyor belt here. It's offline, of course.

infiltrate: ^I realised where they are: in the storage room.

c-1: ^A door, and a sign that says it's the cold room.

c-0: ^ and you can take them by surprise.

g-0: ^You'll be visiting him in porch monkeys' heaven.
g-1: ^Suspicious movement, I had to fire. One deceased.
^The casualty is male, of foreign race, apparent age 18.
^The other prisoners are same race, two females and one male.
g-3: ^For the record: Thartwed attempt at illegal immigration.

b: ^The door of the cold room is locked.
^I can only break into the storage room now.

c-0: ^No more time. We'll deal with her later.
c-1: ^Hell yeah. We'll deal with her later.

b: ^he door of the cold room is locked.
^I can only break into the storage room now.

wait_in_fridge: ^I can't see no passageway to the storage room.

s0: ^There's another door to get out from the opposite end, though

c-1: ^I walked back and now I'm moving toward the door leading to the storage room.

freeze_one: ^/I suppose that Red Team won't be pursuing migrants anymore.

s: ^/You guys really have no sense of humour

c-1: ^Let's go to the storage room together.

victory: ^(«YOU HAVE BEEN RECOGNISED: XERO PAONONGA, 18. STOP!»)
^(«YOU HAVE BEEN RECOGNISED: KALIFA OKEKE DIYA, 18. STOP!»)
^(«YOU HAVE BEEN RECOGNISED: RACHIDA NANSUBUGA, 24. STOP!»)
^(«YOU HAVE BEEN RECOGNISED: KANTIGI OKEKE DIYA, 14. STOP!»)
